intro: Dacrydium beccarii, commonly known as the mountain pine or New Zealand mountain pine, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its slender, straight trunk and dense, dark green foliage. The plant has needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in spirals around the stems. It produces small, spherical cones that contain the plant's seeds. Dacrydium beccarii is well adapted to grow in cool, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions.
